definition: to breathe heavily like an ox (idiom)/to huff and puff
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome

sentences.english: And I’ve stifled in the muggy air of Hefei in Anhui.
sentences.chinese: 亦曾在安徽合肥的悶熱天氣中氣喘如牛。

sentences.english: At my youthful age, it caused me to pant .
sentences.chinese: 在我年輕的歲月，它可是會讓我氣喘如牛的。

sentences.english: He panted excitedly giving us the news he had just heard it.
sentences.chinese: 他氣喘如牛，興奮地告訴我們他剛剛聽到的事。

sentences.english: They were out of breath after a mile race.
sentences.chinese: 經過了一英里的賽跑之後他們氣喘如牛。
